comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment:
typo on _Mandatory_, additional _a_ before the _d_
wonder should we rename this to _getMandatoryProofReasonElectivesForAbsenceReasonOnServiceAgreement_? Just a play on words but probably reads better,

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: A good catch, it is difficult to track such typos. Thanks. However this method is already renamed as the requirements changed and a new solution is in place. I have commited the changes on Last Friday last week.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: wondering if we should put the check _reasonElectives.isProofOfLeaveMandatory()_ before the check for equals. No point checking this after the equals as the API is _mainly_ concerned with those that have _mandatory proof_ as true

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
The requirement is changed and hence this method is updated accordingly. Thanks for the comment. I will keep this in mind for next implmentaions.
Anyway related to which thing to check first, it could be either way. Your way: Check if it is Mandatory first. In that case you will get so many ReasonElectives that have it Mandatory. But then you check for if that is related to the Absencereason. My way as was in the code: Check if this ReasonElectives is aoosciated to the Absencereason then only it makes sence to see if it has ProofOfLeave as Manadtory. So I went with this appraoch.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: Same comment as above

comments.author: Conor Hogan
comments.comment: If it needs two lines of commented then better variables names are needed or it should be in a method with a javadoc.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Agreed that it is a long comment but that just gives a detail about why that branch was made. As it wa s big one I created 2 lines of comment with logical stating points. Now I made it one line and the auto break made it two comment lines again. I will not put this detail in the method as it would need more detail to realy describe various cases.

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-5974: Implementation of an Info message when there is a Negative AC balance while Allowing Time Off

comments.author: Katarzyna Kurszewska
comments.comment: wrong beginning of comment

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Two logical issues:
1. For each selected DecisionDay if the projected balance is found negative a separate message is created. I think that is not the requirement. Move the Message creation code out of For loop.
2. When the Message creation code is moved out then you must add a break statement to stop the further looping.

comments.author: Katarzyna Kurszewska
comments.comment: this if in not necessary. Raising of message can be added in previous if. However I think that is something wrong in this method. I can imagine an example where each day can have negative balance and we will have info message for each day. Are you sure that if (negativeBalanceFound) should be in for loop and no just after it?

comments.author: Katarzyna Kurszewska
comments.comment: name of varibale should be lowercase

comments.author: Katarzyna Kurszewska
comments.comment: you can do it simpler: final List<DecisionDay> decisionDays = Arrays.asList(decionDay);

comments.author: Katarzyna Kurszewska
comments.comment: should be lowercase as above

comments.author: Katarzyna Kurszewska
comments.comment: see previous comment about list

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-5721:MinimumTimeincrement check and Error Message Raised.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: shouldn't be between commas instead of parentheses?

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
1. In the comment sentences there are some words that need not be strated with Caps.
- Selected - Number (mentioned 2 places)
2. Append value as "MinimumTimeIncreament value."
* * DecisionDays and also the number of Allowed DecisionDay(s) in the SelectedLeavePlan being greater than or equal to the MinimumTimeIncrement.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Can't this loop be extracted to a protected method so can be tested in isolation?

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: 1. The comment should be corrected. 2. Also the logic related to MTI on the request level has to be implmented too. (We discussed this today and i think you are taking care of that here soon.)

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment: Please correct the comment: "If there are greater than equal to Allowed Days than the MinimimTimeIncrement in days," This is not easy to folow for a new person. I dont know if you have comitted that change already, but it is not listed in this yet.

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Consider extract the for loop into a protected method to reduce complexity.

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
1. We could move this for loop check to the top and that wll give us some additional performnace benefit as the calculation related to MTI and Allowed DecisionDays count per whole request can be avoided when one selected Decision Day does not meet MTI(Workschedule mismatch.)
2. We could add a break once we get one selected decision Day that does not meet MTI.
